What is the bit rate/stats on this puppy? Listened to the songs off his website, and was pleasantly surprised. A genuine talent, and without going over the top, this is a really good album, with a Uni/College rock sound: I can guess the influences. I like that sound. Some of the instruments are too loud, which detracts from the experience, but that's a technical detail which can be fixed. In short, I need to adopt this kid because (A) he's going to blow up and be my meal ticket, and (B) to keep him safe because everyone's going to want a piece of him. I would love to see him in concert!

George & his brother Jack were in the UK band These New Puritans.  This is George's 1st solo album and it has diverse influences from classical-style piano to Average White Band funky horns to Sean Lennon (mid-2000's) and Elliot Smith (RIP).  Even though the listed influences of These New Puritans are The Fall/PiL and other punk and post-punk bands.

It is great rock/pop and George is obviously a (former) child prodigy ala Ben Lee (Noise Addict).

This is a great debut LP George with songs showing a mature outlook on life; which I can only assume will get better as you hit your 20's.

There are some really talented musos who have yet to hit the mainstream (my nephew is a future guitar god and the same age as you George); but when they do - well, it will be goodbye to generic rap and hello to 21st century rock/pop.

BTW If you want George's kind of loud voice message at 00 in the file listing not to appear on your burned CD copy - just take the tick off the file.

FYI: I've been listening to many musical styles going back to the 1920's through to today (which is a bit sparse apart from Interpol).

There is always some good throughout each decade of recorded music history.  I like both Paul Robeson and AC/DC (amongst several thousand other great artists who put all they have into their recordings).

Thanks again George for an impressive debut album.  I hope to see an even better and more soul-revealing 2nd effort.

Cheers mate + thks for the free.
@gayavenger: "goodbye to generic rap and hello to 21st century rock/pop" oh how I wish that day will come, much, much sooner!!
